thread.title: St. Bonaventure storms court after apparent game-winner, gets technical, loses in overtime
thread.title_full: St. Bonaventure storms court after apparent game-winner, gets technical, loses in overtime

author: Mike Rutherford
title: St. Bonaventure storms court after apparent game-winner, gets technical, loses in overtime
text:
The most brutal defeat of 2016-17 just happened. 
In a matter of minutes, St. Bonaventure went from celebrating a victory that Bonnies fans would never forget, to trying to process a defeat that anyone who follows college basketball will never forget. 
Trailing Atlantic 10-leading VCU by two points with 3.2 seconds to play, St. Bonaventure’s Matt Mobley hit a tough three-pointer that appeared to give the Bonnies a dramatic victory. Despite the clock showing that there were 0.4 seconds still left to play, the St. Bonaventure bench players and fans mobbed the court. 
Brutal way to lose.
St. Bonaventure assessed a technical for premature court storm. VCU would make the foul shot to force OT & win. pic.twitter.com/Eel1pc2bMq 
— Matt Schick (@ESPN_Schick) February 4, 2017 St. Bonaventure hit this three to go up 1 against VCU w .4 secs left on the clock. Students stormed the court, SBU got T'd up, lost in OT. pic.twitter.com/CTAAFddbYA 
— B.J. Boyer (@wcboyer24) February 4, 2017 The officials assessed St. Bonaventure a technical foul for the players leaving the bench and the students coming onto the court. The result was one foul shot for VCU’s JeQuan Lewis, who calmly sank it to send the game into overtime. 
VCU outscored the stunned Bonnies by six in the extra frame, securing a huge 83-77 victory that allowed it to keep pace with Dayton at the top of the A-10. The loss dropped St. Bonaventure to 14-8 overall and 6-4 in league play.
